author: Chirishman
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

Download the 32 bit ARM release and run it on the latest release version of Win10 IOT Core

```powershell
PS C:\Data\Users\administrator> [System.IO.Ports.SerialPort]::GetPortNames()
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Return a list of port names

Actual behavior
---------------

```PowerShell
PS C:\Data\Users\administrator> [System.IO.Ports.SerialPort]::GetPortNames()
⢄腡  敖軎联透       貀↑ 器軎腔﨔軎﹅腔      ☻ က诀࿰ 透   腡☺ 透  煮軎腍媗㼡媗㼡難軎腍      ♥踠쀣☺ 變軎腋  敖軎⫐腡倀㼡    ☺   耈透踤쀣ৈজজঀজঀ  퀀鄌♦   " 뀴醆■&﬘軎疃醆퀀鄌♦
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @Chirishman Please move the Issue to CoreFX repo.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: [System.IO.Ports.SerialPort]::GetPortNames() Throws random garbage in Arm32
